intro: Anemoclema, commonly known as the windflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, dandelion-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant is native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in South America. Anemoclema species are often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. They produce small, wind-dispersed seeds, which contribute to their ability to colonize new areas effectively.
